section: Section 1 – Electrical Engineering and Radio Engineering

questions.question_body: How many megahertz (MHz) are equal to 144432 kilohertz (kHz)?
If the radio station scale reads 145.550 MHz, how many kilohertz (kHz) does this correspond to?
If a current of 3000 mA flows through an ammeter graduated in amperes (A), what will its reading be?
If a voltmeter graduated in volts (V) measures a voltage of 3500 mV, what will its reading be?
How many farads (F) are 500000 microfarads (µF)?
How many nanofarads (nF) are 1000000 picofarads (pF)?
How many hertz (Hz) are in one kHz?
How many kilohertz (kHz) are in one MHz?
If you have a portable radio station with a power of 500 milliwatts (mW), how many W is this?
What is the flow of electrons passing through an electrical circuit called?
What is the basic unit for measuring electric current strength?
What forces electrons to move through an electrical circuit?
What is the basic unit for measuring electrical voltage?
What voltage can be obtained from a car battery?
What voltage can be obtained from a household wall socket?
Which three materials are good electrical conductors?
Which four substances (materials) are good electrical insulators?
What does an electrical insulator do?
questions.А: Allows electric current to pass in one direction
questions.Б: Does not allow electric current to pass
questions.В: When illuminated, allows electric current to pass

questions.question_body: What limits the current flowing through an electrical circuit if the voltage does not change?
What is the basic unit for measuring resistance?
What is the name of the law showing the relationship between voltage, current and resistance in an electrical circuit?
If a current of 2 amperes flows through a resistor with a resistance of 50 ohms, what voltage will we measure at the terminals of the resistor?
If we apply a voltage of 200 volts to a 100 ohm resistor, what current will flow through the resistor?
If a current of 3 amperes flows through a resistor connected to a voltage of 90 volts, what is the resistance of the resistor?
What is the quantity we use to describe how quickly electrical energy is used (consumed)?
If you use three electric bulbs labeled 60 W, 75 W and 100 W, which one will consume electrical energy the fastest?
What is the basic unit for measuring electrical power?
Through which electrical circuit does no electric current flow?
Through which electrical circuit flows too much current?
What is current that flows only in one direction called?
What is current that flows in both directions, first in one, then in the other, called?
What term denotes the number of times alternating current changes direction per second?
What is the basic unit for measuring frequency?
What frequencies can humans hear?
Why are frequencies in the range 20 - 20000 Hz called audio frequencies?
questions.А: Because the human ear is not sensitive in this range
questions.Б: Because the human ear hears sounds in this range
questions.В: Because the human ear hears radio waves in this range
questions.Г: Because it is too low for radio wave propagation

questions.question_body: Which of the following frequencies do we call radio frequency?
In which frequency range does an electrical oscillation with a frequency of 145450 kHz fall?
If a radio wave has 3725000 periods per second, what does this mean?
questions.Г: That its speed is 3725 kilometers per second

questions.question_body: What is the distance that an alternating current signal travels in one period called?
What happens to the wavelength if its frequency increases?
What happens to the frequency of a signal if its wavelength increases?
What does 50 hertz (Hz) mean?
What is the frequency of the voltage from the household wall socket?
What is the basic unit for measuring inductance?
Which of the symbols represents a resistor (resistance)?
Which of the circuit components is a variable resistor (potentiometer)?
Which of the circuit components is a switch?
Which of the circuit components is a fuse?
Which of the circuit components is a battery?
Which of the symbols represents a ground?
Which of the symbols represents an antenna?
Which of the symbols represents a capacitor?
Which of the symbols represents an n-p-n bipolar transistor?
Which of the symbols represents a p-n-p bipolar transistor?
Which of the symbols represents a diode?
What is the approximate length of a half-wave dipole for the 144 - 146 MHz range?
What is the approximate length of a quarter-wave vertical antenna for the 432 - 438 MHz range?
Due to what advantage do many radio amateurs use a 5/8 λ antenna instead of a quarter-wave vertical antenna when operating in VHF bands from a car?
What is the radiation pattern of a 5/8 λ vertical antenna?
questions.А: Slightly directional, signal concentrates in two opposite directions
questions.Б: Omnidirectional in horizontal plane, in vertical plane signal concentrates high above horizon
questions.В: Omnidirectional in horizontal plane, in vertical plane signal concentrates close to horizon
questions.Г: Directional with one clearly defined maximum

questions.question_body: What type of antenna has a radiation pattern in which the signal concentrates in a specific direction?
What radiation pattern does a horizontally positioned Yagi antenna have?
questions.Б: Directional pattern with one pronounced maximum
questions.В: Slightly directional with two equal maxima in opposite directions
questions.Г: Pattern with maximum radiation in vertical direction

questions.question_body: What are the elements of a three-element Yagi antenna called?
Why should you position your antennas so that no one can touch them while you are transmitting?
questions.А: Such contact will detune the antenna and cause interference in television reception
questions.Б: Such contact can burn the person who touched it
questions.В: Such contact can reflect the transmitted signal back to the transmitter and damage the output stage
questions.Г: Such contact will lead to emission of harmonic frequencies from the antenna

questions.question_body: What is a coaxial cable?
questions.А: Two parallel conductors in flexible plastic insulation
questions.Б: Two parallel conductors fixed with fasteners at a constant distance from each other
questions.В: Two twisted conductors with rubber insulation between them
questions.Г: A central conductor covered with insulation and surrounded by a conductive shield

questions.question_body: What is the main advantage of coaxial cable?
questions.А: Any radio amateur can make it at home
questions.Б: Its impedance matches that of the most commonly used amateur radio antennas

questions.question_body: Which of the most commonly used antenna cables can be run underground without adverse effects?
When the antenna line must pass near metal objects, which cable should be used?
What is a balanced feed line?
questions.Б: A conductor with insulator applied to it and then covered with a shield and waterproof jacket
questions.В: A metal tube whose diameter is equal to or slightly larger than the wavelength of the signal
questions.Г: Two parallel conductors at a constant distance from each other

questions.question_body: Can balanced cable for television antennas be used as an antenna feed line for an amateur radio station and how?
questions.А: By carefully laying it close to the outer walls of the building
questions.Б: By using a more powerful output stage
questions.В: By installing a matching device between the transmitter and the line
questions.Г: It cannot be used at all

questions.question_body: What is an advantage of balanced feed line over coaxial cable?
questions.А: Provides safer operation with the radio station
questions.Б: Is not affected by nearby metal objects

questions.question_body: What is the polarization of the signal radiated by a horizontal four-element Yagi antenna whose elements are positioned parallel to the ground?
What is the polarization of the signal radiated by a horizontal four-element Yagi antenna whose elements are positioned perpendicular to the ground?
What can happen if you over-modulate the microphone amplifier of your FM transmitter?
questions.А: You may cause digital interference in nearby computers
questions.Б: You may cause interference to radio stations operating on adjacent frequencies
questions.В: You may cause atmospheric interference around the antenna
questions.Г: You may cause interference in the radio station's microprocessor and frequency drift

questions.question_body: When a signal reaches in a straight line from one antenna to another, what is this called?
How does a VHF signal usually reach from the transmitting antenna to the receiving antenna?
What happens to a VHF signal when it hits a metal structure?
questions.Б: It is directed toward the ionosphere
questions.Г: It disperses in the surface atmospheric layer

questions.question_body: What is a signal that propagates along the Earth's surface called?
What is the propagation distance of ionospheric reflection compared to ground wave?
What is the layer of ionized gases above the Earth called?
Why should you ground your antenna when not using your radio station?
questions.А: So that it is not used by another radio amateur
questions.Г: To protect the radio station and building from lightning damage

questions.question_body: How will amateur radio equipment be best protected from lightning damage?
questions.А: By placing it in an insulating housing
questions.Г: By disconnecting it from the mains and antenna cables if there is no lightning protection

questions.question_body: What should be grounded in an amateur radio station for best protection from electric shock?
What is the most suitable place inside a building for grounding an amateur radio station?
questions.А: The grounding bus of the electrical panel

questions.question_body: Where should you connect the housing of your radio station for best protection from electric shock?
Which of these materials is best as a conductor for ground connection?
Why should you use quality coaxial cable for the connection between transmitter and antenna?
questions.А: To deliver maximum power to the antenna
questions.Б: To avoid interfering with television reception
questions.В: To prevent excessive power to the antenna

questions.question_body: Why is a high voltage breaker needed in the radio station rectifier that disconnects it when the radio station housing is removed?
questions.А: To prevent leakage and propagation of dangerous RF energy from the radio station
questions.Б: To prevent penetration of dangerous RF energy into the radio station
questions.В: To turn off the rectifier when not in use and save electricity
questions.Г: To protect the operator removing the housing from electric shock

questions.question_body: What safety measures should you take if working at the top of an antenna mast (tower)?
questions.А: Ground yourself with a suitable metal rope
questions.Б: Wear reflective clothing in an appropriate color
questions.В: Turn on a flashing red, yellow or white light
questions.Г: Use a safety belt, helmet and safety glasses

questions.question_body: Why should you use a safety belt if working at the top of an antenna mast (tower)?
questions.А: So there is no danger of an accidentally dropped tool falling and injuring someone under the mast
questions.Б: To keep the mast balanced while you work
questions.В: So you can lift the maximum number of tools to the top of the mast
questions.Г: To be protected from accidental falling

questions.question_body: For safety reasons, how high should you mount your antenna?
questions.А: High enough so that no one from the ground can touch it
questions.Б: As close to the ground surface as possible
questions.В: High enough that you can easily reach it for tuning and repair

questions.question_body: Why should you put a helmet on your head if you are helping someone from the ground who is working at the top of an antenna mast (tower)?
questions.А: So you won't be injured if the mast accidentally falls
questions.Б: To protect yourself from dangerous RF radiation when testing the antenna
questions.В: To protect your head from something accidentally dropped from the top of the mast
questions.Г: So that casual passers-by understand that work is being done at the top of the mast and bypass it at a distance

questions.question_body: What actions should you take immediately if someone around you is struck by electric shock?
questions.А: Bury them in the ground to drain the electric charge
questions.Г: Call an ambulance, unbutton their clothes and start artificial respiration

questions.question_body: What device is used to measure the standing wave ratio?
What device is used to measure the match between the antenna and feed line?
Where should you connect the SWR meter to measure the standing wave ratio?
questions.А: Between the feed line and antenna

questions.question_body: What does SWR = 1 mean?
questions.А: Probably an antenna for another band is connected
questions.В: No power is entering the antenna

questions.question_body: What does SWR = 1.5 mean?
questions.Б: Lack of match, some failure has occurred in the antenna
questions.Г: The antenna has a gain of 1.5

questions.question_body: What does SWR = 4 mean?
questions.В: The antenna has a gain of 4
questions.Г: Lack of match, some failure has occurred in the antenna

questions.question_body: What SWR meter reading indicates poor electrical contact between separate parts of the antenna system?
What does a very high SWR meter reading mean?
questions.А: The antenna has inappropriate dimensions or there is a break in the feed line
questions.Б: The signals radiated by the antenna are very strong, indicating good match
questions.В: The transmitter is radiating more energy than normal, which is a warning of imminent failure
questions.Г: Very strong solar activity, indicating poor propagation

questions.question_body: If your neighbor complains of television reception interference when you are conducting amateur radio contacts with your radio station, what is the most likely cause of the interference?
questions.Б: Deionization of the ionosphere around your neighbor's antenna
questions.Г: Spurious and harmonic emissions from your transmitter

questions.question_body: What does "harmonic emissions" mean?
questions.А: Unwanted signals with a frequency that is a multiple of the selected fundamental frequency
questions.Б: Unwanted signals containing 50 Hz mains hum
questions.В: Perfect signals in harmony with all standards
questions.Г: Signals that cause the appearance of sporadic propagation

questions.question_body: Why are harmonic emissions from an amateur radio station undesirable?
questions.А: Because they can cause interference to other radio stations and emission outside the permitted bands
questions.Б: Because they lead to high electricity consumption
questions.В: Because they can cause resonance in nearby transmitters
questions.Г: Because they cause ionization of the air

questions.question_body: What is the main purpose of the shielding metal housing of the transmitter?
questions.А: Improves the operation of the antenna filter
questions.В: Protects against unwanted emission of RF energy
questions.Г: Maintains the temperature of electronic elements to keep them stable

questions.question_body: What problem can arise if you use your radio station without the outer metal housing?
questions.Б: The quality of modulation may deteriorate
questions.В: The power of the output stage may decrease

questions.question_body: If you are notified that your radio station is causing television reception interference, what action should you take?
questions.А: Make sure first that the station is being used correctly and that it does not cause interference to your television
questions.Б: Turn off the transmitter immediately and request a measurement by the regulatory authority
questions.В: Install an appropriate filter at the transmitter output
questions.Г: Continue to work with the radio station because you have no reason to worry about interference

questions.question_body: What connects your radio station to the antenna?
Which of the following should you never connect to the output of your transmitter?
Which device converts mains voltage to 12 V DC voltage?
Which device usually requires a power supply with the highest power?
If your transmitter has a peak envelope power (PEP) of 2 W, which power supply is most suitable for it?
